lyrics:
Thought I found a way
Thought I found a way out (found)
But you never go away (never go away)

So I guess I gotta stay now

Oh, I hope some day I′ll make it out of here
Even if it takes all night or a hundred years
Need a place to hide, but I can't find one near
Wanna feel alive, outside I can′t fight my fear

Isn't it lovely? All alone
Heart made of glass, my mind of stone
Tear me to pieces, skin to bone
Hello, welcome home

Walking out of town
Looking for a better place (looking for a better place)
Something's on my mind
Always in my head space

But I know someday I′ll make it out of here
Even if it takes all night or a hundred years
Need a place to hide, but I can′t find one near
Wanna feel alive, outside I can't fight my fear

Isn′t it lovely? All alone
Heart made of glass, my mind of stone
Tear me to pieces, skin to bone
Hello, welcome home

Woah, yeah
Yeah, ah
Woah, woah

Hello, welcome home
imageDescription: The image is a lone figure standing on the edge of a cliff overlooking a vast, open landscape. The sky is filled with stars, symbolizing hope and possibility. The figure's heart is made of fragile glass, representing vulnerability, while their mind is depicted as a solid stone, signifying strength and resilience. Tear marks are etched on their face, revealing the pain they have endured. It is a bittersweet homecoming, filled with both longing and acceptance.
